text:
Write a 250 word essay on the role of power in the Lord of the Rings series. The essay should focus on how Tolkien portrays power as corrupting and how this theme is reflected in the characters of Gollum, Boromir, and Denethor.
In J.R.R. Tolkien's Lord of the Rings series, power is portrayed as a corrupting influence that can destroy even the strongest of wills. This theme is reflected in the characters of Gollum, Boromir, and Denethor, each of whom is consumed by their own desires for power and ultimately succumb to its corrupting effects.

Gollum, once a hobbit named Sm√©agol, is perhaps the most tragic example of the corrupting influence of power. His obsession with the One Ring, which he refers to as "my precious," has consumed him entirely, driving him to commit unspeakable acts of violence and betrayal. Despite his initial intentions to use the Ring for good, Gollum becomes so enthralled by its power that he loses all sense of morality and compassion.

Boromir, son of Denethor, is another character who falls prey to the corrupting influence of power. His desire to possess the One Ring and use it to defend Gondor against the armies of Mordor leads him to attempt to take it from Frodo, demonstrating how even the noblest of intentions can be twisted by the lure of power.
